column1: A CSF glucose test measures the amount of sugar (glucose) in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).
They include: - Cisternal puncture - Ventricular puncture - Removal of CSF from a tube that is already in the CSF, such as a shunt or ventricular drain The sample is sent to a laboratory for testing.
The glucose level in the CSF should be 50 to 80 mg/100 mL (or greater than 2/3 of the blood sugar level).
